info.title: Terminal49 API Reference
info.description:
The Terminal 49 API offers a convenient way to programmatically track your shipments from origin to destination.

Please enter your API key into the "Variables" tab before using these endpoints within Postman.

error.title: Invalid arrival_date_from

get.description:
Returns a list of your shipments. The shipments are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recent shipments appearing first.

This api will return all shipments associated with the account. Shipments created via the `tracking_request` API aswell as the ones added via the dashboard will be retuned via this endpoint.

parameters.name: page[number]
page[size]
q
parameters.description: Search shipments by master bill of lading, reference number, or container number.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Comma delimited list of relations to include

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: Search shipments by the original request tracking `request_number`

parameters.name: filter[tracking_stopped]
parameters.description: Filter shipments by whether they are still tracking or not

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Shipment Id

get.description: Retrieves the details of an existing shipment. You need only supply the unique shipment `id` that was returned upon `tracking_request` creation.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Comma delimited list of relations to include

patch.description:
We'll stop tracking the shipment, which means that there will be no more updates.  You can still access the shipment's previously-collected information via the API or dashboard.

You can resume tracking a shipment by calling the `resume_tracking` endpoint, but keep in mind that some information is only made available by our data sources at specific times, so a stopped and resumed shipment may have some information missing.
Resume tracking a shipment.  Keep in mind that some information is only made available by our data sources at specific times, so a stopped and resumed shipment may have some information missing.

errors.title: Unprocessable Entity
errors.detail: Scac 'UALC' is not supported. We do not currently integrate with Universal Africa Lines

429.description: Too Many Requests - You've hit the create tracking requests limit. Please try again in a minute.

detail.example: You've hit the create tracking requests limit. Please try again in a minute.

Retry-After.description: Number of seconds to wait before making another request

request_type.description: The type of document number to be supplied. Container number support is currently in BETA.

ref_numbers.description: Optional list of reference numbers to be added to the shipment when tracking request completes

shipment_tags.description: Optional list of tags to be added to the shipment when tracking request completes

post.description:
To track an ocean shipment, you create a new tracking request. Two attributes are required to track a shipment. A `bill of lading/booking number` and a shipping line `SCAC`. Once a tracking request is created we will attempt to fetch the shipment details and it's related containers from the shipping line. If the attempt is successful we will create in new shipment object including any related container objects. We will send a `tracking_request.succeeded` webhook notification to your webhooks. If the attempt to fetch fails then we will send a `tracking_request.failed` webhook notification to your `webhooks`. A `tracking_request.succeeded` or `tracking_request.failed` webhook notificaiton will only be sent if you have atleast one active webhook.

This endpoint is limited to 100 tracking requests per minute.

get.description: Returns a list of your tracking requests. The tracking requests are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recent tracking request appearing first.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: A search term to be applied against request_number and reference_numbers.

post.description: Predict the carrier SCAC (VOCC) and number type from a tracking number. Provide a container number, bill of lading number, or booking number and receive the predicted carrier with confidence and a decision value. Use this to auto-populate carrier fields before creating a tracking request.

post.description:
You can configure a webhook via the API to be notified about events that happen in your Terminal49 account. These events can be realted to tracking_requests, shipments and containers. 

This is the recommended way tracking shipments and containers via the API. You should use this instead of polling our the API periodically.

url.description: The URL of the webhook endpoint.

events.description: The list of events to enable for this endpoint.

headers.description: Optional custom headers to pass with each webhook invocation

name.description: The name of the header. (Please note this will be auto-capitalized)

value.description: The value to pass for the header

parameters.description: Comma delimited list of relations to include.

get.description:
#### Deprecation warning
The `raw_events` endpoint is provided as-is.

 For past events we recommend consuming `transport_events`.

---
Get a list of past and future (estimated) milestones for a container as reported by the carrier. Some of the data is normalized even though the API is called raw_events. 

Normalized attributes: `event` and `timestamp` timestamp. Not all of the `event` values have been normalized. You can expect the the events related to container movements to be normalized but there are cases where events are not normalized. 

For past historical events we recommend consuming `transport_events`. Although there are fewer events here those events go through additional vetting and normalization to avoid false positives and get you correct data.

Get a list of past transport events (canonical) for a container. All data has been normalized across all carriers. These are a verified subset of the raw events may also be sent as Webhook Notifications to a webhook endpoint.

This does not provide any estimated future events. See `container/:id/raw_events` endpoint for that.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Comma delimited list of relations to include

detail.example: Routing data feature is not enabled for this account

get.description: Returns a GeoJSON FeatureCollection containing all map-related data for a container, including port locations, current vessel position (if at sea), past vessel paths, and estimated future routes. The response can be directly used with most mapping libraries (Leaflet, Mapbox GL, Google Maps, etc.). <Note>This is a paid feature. Please contact sales@terminal49.com.</Note>

patch.description:
Schedules the container to be refreshed immediately from all relevant sources.

To be alerted of updates you should subscribe to the [relevant webhooks](/api-docs/in-depth-guides/webhooks). This endpoint is limited to 10 requests per minute.This is a paid feature. Please contact sales@terminal49.com.

message.example: Started refresh for Shipping line, Terminal, Rail

normalized_number.description: The normalized version of the shipment number used for querying the carrier

line_tracking_last_attempted_at.description: When Terminal49 last tried to update the shipment status from the shipping line

line_tracking_last_succeeded_at.description: When Terminal49 last successfully updated the shipment status from the shipping line

line_tracking_stopped_at.description: When Terminal49 stopped checking at the shipping line

container.title: Container model
container.description: Represents the equipment during a specific journey.

pickup_appointment_at.description: When available the pickup appointment time at the terminal is returned.

availability_known.description: Whether Terminal 49 is receiving availability status from the terminal.

available_for_pickup.description: If availability_known is true, then whether container is available to be picked up at terminal.

pod_arrived_at.description: Time the vessel arrived at the POD

pod_discharged_at.description: Discharge time at the port of discharge

pod_full_out_at.description: Full Out time at port of discharge. Null for inland moves.

terminal_checked_at.description: When the terminal was last checked.

pod_full_out_chassis_number.description: The chassis number used when container was picked up at POD (if available)

location_at_pod_terminal.description: Location at port of discharge terminal

final_destination_full_out_at.description: Pickup time at final destination for inland moves.

pod_timezone.description: IANA tz. Applies to attributes pod_arrived_at, pod_discharged_at, pickup_appointment_at, pod_full_out_at.

final_destination_timezone.description: IANA tz. Applies to attribute final_destination_full_out_at.

empty_terminated_timezone.description: IANA tz. Applies to attribute empty_terminated_at.

pod_rail_carrier_scac.description: The SCAC of the rail carrier for the pickup leg of the container's journey.(BETA)

ind_rail_carrier_scac.description: The SCAC of the rail carrier for the delivery leg of the container's journey.(BETA)

import_deadlines.description: Import pickup deadlines for the container

pickup_lfd_terminal.description: The last free day for pickup before demmurage accrues. Corresponding timezone is pod_timezone.

pickup_lfd_rail.description: The last free day for pickup before demmurage accrues. Corresponding timezone is final_destination_timezone.

pickup_lfd_line.description: The last free day as reported by the line. Corresponding timezone is final_destination_timezone or pod_timezone.

current_status.description: The current status of the container in its journey. [Read guide to learn more.](/api-docs/in-depth-guides/container-statuses)

alternative_scacs.description: Additional SCACs which will be accepted in tracking requests

firms_code.description: CBP FIRMS Code or CBS Sublocation Code

zip.description: ZIP code part of the address

firms_code.description: CBP FIRMS Code or CBS Sublocation Code

failed_reason.description: If the tracking request has failed, or is currently failing, the last reason we were unable to complete the request

retry_count.description: How many times T49 has attempted to get the shipment from the shipping line

active.description: Whether the webhook will be delivered when events are triggered

events.description: The list of events to enabled for this endpoint

secret.description: A random token that will sign all delivered webhooks

name.description: The name of the ship or vessel

latitude.description: The current latitude position of the vessel

longitude.description: The current longitude position of the vessel

nautical_speed_knots.description: The current speed of the ship in knots (nautical miles per hour)

navigational_heading_degrees.description: The current heading of the ship in degrees, where 0 is North, 90 is East, 180 is South, and 270 is West

position_timestamp.description: The timestamp of when the ship's position was last recorded, in ISO 8601 date and time format

positions.description: An array of historical position data for the vessel. Only included if `show_positions` is true.

data_source.description: The original source of the event data

created_at.description: When the estimated event was created

data_source.description: The original source of the event data

delivery_status.description: Whether the notification has been delivered to the webhook endpoint

description.description: Text description from the terminal (if any)

amount.description: The fee amount in local currency

currency_code.description: The ISO 4217 currency code of the fee is charged in. E.g. USD

changeset.description:
A hash of all the changed attributes with the values being an array of the before and after. E.g. 
`{"pickup_lfd": [null, "2020-05-20"]}`

The current attributes that can be alerted on are:
- `available_for_pickup`
- `pickup_lfd`
- `fees_at_pod_terminal`
- `holds_at_pod_terminal`
- `pickup_appointment_at`
- `pod_terminal`

raw_event.title: Raw Event Model
raw_event.description:
Raw Events represent the milestones from the shipping line for a given container.

### About raw_event datetimes

The events may include estimated future events. The event is a future event if an `estimated_` timestamp is not null. 

The datetime properties `timestamp` and `estimated`. 

When the `time_zone` property is present the datetimes are UTC timestamps, which can be converted to the local time by parsing the provided `time_zone`.

When the `time_zone` property is absent, the datetimes represent local times which serialized as UTC timestamps for consistency.

original_event.description: The event name as returned by the carrier

timestamp.description: The datetime the event either transpired or will occur in UTC

estimated.description: True if the timestamp is estimated, false otherwise

actual_on.description: Deprecated: The date of the event at the event location when no time information is available.

estimated_on.description: Deprecated: The estimated date of the event at the event location when no time information is available.

actual_at.description: Deprecated: The datetime the event transpired in UTC

estimated_at.description: Deprecated: The estimated datetime the event will occur in UTC

timezone.description: IANA tz where the event occured

created_at.description: When the raw_event was created in UTC

location_name.description: The city or facility name of the event location

vessel_name.description: The name of the vessel where applicable

vessel_imo.description: The IMO of the vessel where applicable

index.description: The order of the event. This may be helpful when only dates (i.e. actual_on) are available.

data_source.description: Where the information about the terminal change came from

timestamp.description: When the terminal change was recorded

terminal.description: The terminal the container has changed to. If this container is still on the vessel this represents an advisory. If it was previously at the terminal this represents an off-dock move.

name.description: The name of the ship or vessel

latitude.description: The current latitude position of the vessel

longitude.description: The current longitude position of the vessel

nautical_speed_knots.description: The current speed of the ship in knots (nautical miles per hour)

navigational_heading_degrees.description: The current heading of the ship in degrees, where 0 is North, 90 is East, 180 is South, and 270 is West

position_timestamp.description: The timestamp of when the ship's position was last recorded, in ISO 8601 date and time format

ports_sequence.description: The sequence number of this port in the route (1 = POL, last = POD)

ports_total.description: Total number of ports in the route

location_id.description: Unique identifier for the port location

label.description: Port label: POL, POD, or TS1, TS2, etc.

updated_at.description: Last update timestamp from the shipment (ISO 8601)

ports_sequence.description: Sequence number of the departure port for this leg

departure_port_id.description: ID of the port the vessel departed from

departure_port_label.description: Label of departure port (POL, POD, TS1, etc.)

departure_port_atd.description: Actual time of departure from the port (ISO 8601)

arrival_port_id.description: ID of the next port the vessel is heading to

arrival_port_label.description: Label of arrival port (POL, POD, TS1, etc.)

arrival_port_eta.description: Estimated time of arrival at the next port (ISO 8601)

ports_sequence.description: Sequence number of the departure port for this leg

vessel_id.description: Unique identifier for the vessel that traveled this path

point_count.description: Number of coordinate points in the LineString

outbound_atd_at.description: Actual time of departure from the origin port (ISO 8601)

inbound_ata_at.description: Actual time of arrival at the destination port (ISO 8601)

inbound_eta_at.description: Estimated time of arrival at the destination port (ISO 8601)

ports_sequence.description: Sequence number of the departure port for this leg

point_count.description: Number of coordinate points in the LineString

ports_sequence.description: Sequence number of the departure port for this leg

current_port_id.description: ID of the port the vessel departed from

next_port_id.description: ID of the next port the vessel is heading to

point_count.description: Number of coordinate points in the LineString

authorization.name: Authorization
authorization.description:
`Token YOUR_API_TOKEN`

The APIs require authentication to be done using header-based API Key and Secret Authentication. 

API key and secret are sent va the `Authorization` request header.

You send your API key and secret in the following way:

`Authorization: Token YOUR_API_KEY`
